repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Promoting Innovation to Enhance
            Competitiveness Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Promoting Innovation to
            Enhance Competitiveness Project for Uruguay were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            low or negligible, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: strong government support is
            crucial for quick and smooth implementation, but increased
            political coordination among executive branches may be
            necessary to move forward. The creation of a single agency
            responsible for the implementation of science, technology,
            and innovation (STI) programs improves coordination,
            efficacy, and efficiency of the STI policy. It is a good
            practice for STI projects to address and integrate different
            pillars of the STI system, by including actions that affect
            both demand and supply of knowledge and innovation. The
            project design should envisage early proactive action by the
            implementing agency to develop a partnership culture and
            demand, especially among the private sector. In designing a
            results matrix for STI projects, teams should consider the
            long term usually associated with the development of
            innovation outcomes, as well as the country-specific context
            that is likely to have a direct impact on STI through
            different channels - the education system, the level of
            international integration, and the industrial strategy. It
            may be especially important for the task team and the
            implementing agency to rapidly incorporate early lessons and
            changed circumstances.

repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Promoting Innovation to Enhance
            Competitiveness Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Promoting Innovation to Enhance Competitiveness Project for
            Uruguay is to strengthen Uruguay's capacity to
            generate, transfer and adapt knowledge and technology by
            supporting: (i) the institutional framework for science,
            technology, and innovation (STI); (ii) investments in human
            capital and high-quality research teams; (iii) technology
            transfer and private sector innovation; and (iv)
            cross-sectoral and international research collaboration and
            mobility of researchers between public institutions and the
            productive sector. The main purpose of this restructuring is
            to extend the closing date of the project, in order to allow
            for a more complete realization of Project Development
            Objectives (PDOs). In particular, there is room to fully
            achieve the objective of 'strengthen capacity to
            transfer knowledge and technology', by improving and
            completing execution of activities. Taking advantage of this
            restructuring process, additional changes encompassing the
            three components and indicators will strengthen
            implementation and monitoring of the project as a whole.
            Consistent with the changes to project activities and
            timetable, PDO indicators will change as follows: one
            indicator will be dropped; one new indicator will be
            created; four indicators will be revised in structure and or
            target. Targets for eight out of eighteen intermediate
            indicators included in the 2010 restructuring will change to
            reflect the evolution of activities observed until 2012 and
            two new intermediate indicators will be created to monitor
            key activities. The closing date will be extended by 18
            months to June 13, 2014.

display_title.display_title:
Uruguay - Promoting Innovation to
            Enhance Competitiveness Project : restructuring : Main report
